derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Latin acceleratio(n-), from accelerare 'hasten' (see accelerate)

entry.def: The acceleration of a process or change is the fact that it is getting faster and faster.

example.ex: He has also called for an acceleration of political reforms.
example.tran: 他同时呼吁加快政治改革的步伐。

entry.tran: （汽车等的）加速能力，加速幅度
entry.def: Acceleration is the rate at which a car or other vehicle can increase its speed, often seen in terms of the time that it takes to reach a particular speed.

example.ex: Acceleration to 60 mph takes a mere 5.7 seconds.
example.tran: 加速到时速60英里只需要5.7秒。

entry.def: Acceleration is the rate at which the speed of an object increases.

sentences.sentence: "modern science caused an acceleration of cultural change"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of accelerating; increasing the speed
3. (physics) a rate of change of velocity

auth_sentence.content: Some have detected an acceleration and he has not.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some have detected an acceleration and he has not.

auth_sentence.content: Do not confuse this acceleration, with dark matter.

auth_sentence.content: It uses two techniques to understand the acceleration.

stems_affixes.word_buile: accelerate[v.加速]+or人或物器→accelerator加速者,加速器
celer快,速度+ity性质→快的性质→迅速
ac加强+celer速度→一再增加速度
de变慢+celer速度+ate使→使速度变慢

sentences.en: All spacemen must be able to bear acceleration.
sentences.cn: 所有太空人都应能承受加速度。
